issue.title: chore(deps): update module google.golang.org/grpc to v1.57.1 [security]

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [google.golang.org/grpc](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go) | indirect | patch | `v1.57.0` -> `v1.57.1` |

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [GHSA-m425-mq94-257g](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/security/advisories/GHSA-m425-mq94-257g)

### Impact
In affected releases of gRPC-Go, it is possible for an attacker to send HTTP/2 requests, cancel them, and send subsequent requests, which is valid by the HTTP/2 protocol, but would cause the gRPC-Go server to launch more concurrent method handlers than the configured maximum stream limit.

### Patches
This vulnerability was addressed by #​6703 and has been included in patch releases: 1.56.3, 1.57.1, 1.58.3.  It is also included in the latest release, 1.59.0.

Along with applying the patch, users should also ensure they are using the `grpc.MaxConcurrentStreams` server option to apply a limit to the server's resources used for any single connection.

### Workarounds
None.

### References

#​6703

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>grpc/grpc-go (google.golang.org/grpc)</summary>

### [`v1.57.1`](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/releases/tag/v1.57.1): Release 1.57.1

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/compare/v1.57.0...v1.57.1)

### Security

-   server: prohibit more than MaxConcurrentStreams handlers from running at once (CVE-2023-44487)

    In addition to this change, applications should ensure they do not leave running tasks behind related to the RPC before returning from method handlers, or should enforce appropriate limits on any such work.

</details>

---

### Configuration

📅 **Schedule**: Branch creation - "" in timezone UTC, Automerge - At any time (no schedule defined).

🚦 **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.

♻ **Rebasing**: Whenever PR is behind base branch, or you tick the rebase/retry checkbox.

🔕 **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.

---

 - [ ] <!-- rebase-check -->If you want to rebase/retry this PR, check this box

---

This PR has been generated by [Mend Renovate](https://www.mend.io/free-developer-tools/renovate/). View repository job log [here](https://developer.mend.io/github/containers/buildah).

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [GHSA-m425-mq94-257g](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/security/advisories/GHSA-m425-mq94-257g)

### Impact
In affected releases of gRPC-Go, it is possible for an attacker to send HTTP/2 requests, cancel them, and send subsequent requests, which is valid by the HTTP/2 protocol, but would cause the gRPC-Go server to launch more concurrent method handlers than the configured maximum stream limit.

### Patches
This vulnerability was addressed by #​6703 and has been included in patch releases: 1.56.3, 1.57.1, 1.58.3.  It is also included in the latest release, 1.59.0.

Along with applying the patch, users should also ensure they are using the `grpc.MaxConcurrentStreams` server option to apply a limit to the server's resources used for any single connection.

### Workarounds
None.

### References

#​6703

---

<details>

### [`v1.57.1`](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/releases/tag/v1.57.1): Release 1.57.1

-   server: prohibit more than MaxConcurrentStreams handlers from running at once (CVE-2023-44487)

issue.title: fix(deps): update module github.com/containerd/containerd to v1.7.8

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [github.com/containerd/containerd](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd) | require | patch | `v1.7.7` -> `v1.7.8` | --- ### Release Notes
containerd/containerd (github.com/containerd/containerd) ### [`v1.7.8`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/releases/tag/v1.7.8): containerd 1.7.8 [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/compare/v1.7.7...v1.7.8) Welcome to the v1.7.8 release of containerd! The eighth patch release for containerd 1.7 contains various fixes and updates. ##### Notable Updates - **Fix ambiguous TLS fallback** ([#​9299](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9299)) - **Update Go to 1.20.10** ([#​9265](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9265)) - **Add a new image label on converted schema 1 images** ([#​9252](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9252)) - **Fix handling for missing basic auth credentials** ([#​9235](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9235)) - **Fix potential deadlock in create handler for containerd-shim-runc-v2** ([#​9209](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9209)) See the changelog for complete list of changes Please try out the release binaries and report any issues at https://github.com/containerd/containerd/issues. ##### Contributors - Sebastiaan van Stijn - Derek McGowan - Phil Estes - Chen Yiyang - Wei Fu - Akihiro Suda - Maksym Pavlenko - Marat Radchenko - Milas Bowman - Qiutong Song - Samuel Karp ##### Changes
27 commits

- \[release/1.7] Prepare release notes for v1.7.8 ([#​9278](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9278)) - [`48dbdf871`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/48dbdf871b43ca94f243779bd641fcda49c94f66) Prepare release notes for v1.7.8 - \[release/1.7] Fix ambiguous tls fallback ([#​9299](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9299)) - [`68abc543b`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/68abc543b1eb4a8196842de6c83115ba4e5698b0) Check scheme and host of request on push redirect - [`35c7634e3`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/35c7634e33651053a934bbcb831c90ddc65ede2e) Avoid TLS fallback when protocol is not ambiguous - \[release/1.7] vendor: google.golang.org/grpc v1.58.3 ([#​9281](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9281)) - [`f36948cad`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/f36948cad712b9f813518ceaa5ac5441b6e10347) vendor: gRPC v1.58.3 - \[release/1.7 backport] vendor: golang.org/x/net v0.17.0 ([#​9276](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9276)) - [`c67a53190`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/c67a5319050614a947c9e5c133e44164e487a223) vendor: golang.org/x/net v0.17.0 - [`71f4b36ca`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/71f4b36ca7a420d53a9f6c1b3f846a4a94b739de) vendor: golang.org/x/text v0.13.0 - [`a7b3b7090`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/a7b3b70909a99f47845b74a3dbe58032c17bd1e0) vendor: golang.org/x/sys v0.13.0 - \[release/1.7] vendor: google.golang.org/grpc v1.56.3 ([#​9248](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9248)) - [`26736d6e1`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/26736d6e1af5f45386ae9382a6a951aee33c9ca7) vendor: google.golang.org/grpc v1.56.3 - [`54a69a6e4`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/54a69a6e448d61fe88ad90bd476f8f65cf21277f) vendor: golang.org/x/oauth2 v0.7.0 - [`ac15a7f5b`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/ac15a7f5b9da1b45ffc66bb8ccdcaed2f571c73a) vendor: google.golang.org/protobuf v1.30.0 - \[release/1.7] update to go1.20.10, test go1.21.3 ([#​9265](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9265)) - [`2479c3321`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/2479c332173014f3086d9b016214c536a7c03f39) \[release/1.7] update to go1.20.10, test go1.21.3 - [`11f40e9d8`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/11f40e9d80409b8dfa9dcb3eb81934e08384dd8e) \[release/1.7] update to go1.20.9, test go1.21.2 - \[release/1.7] Add a new image label if it is docker schema 1 ([#​9252](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9252)) - [`cac1bab79`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/cac1bab797ed8d1245bff49aa90e6c80d8714899) Add a new image label if it is docker schema 1 - \[release/1.7] remotes: add handling for missing basic auth credentials ([#​9235](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9235)) - [`6cd2cc4a8`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/6cd2cc4a8f035162e06d5ffbf868c540e7eb40eb) remotes: add handling for missing basic auth credentials - \[release/1.7 backport] containerd-shim-runc-v2: avoid potential deadlock in create handler ([#​9209](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9209)) - [`d0a1fedb5`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/d0a1fedb5a4828daddff330a345780d0222e47e8) \*: add runc-fp as runc wrapper to inject failpoint - pull_request.title: fix(deps): update module github.com/containerd/containerd to v1.7.8
pull_request.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Type | Update | Change | |---|---|---|---| | [github.com/containerd/containerd](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd) | require | patch | `v1.7.7` -> `v1.7.8` | --- ### Release Notes
containerd/containerd (github.com/containerd/containerd) ### [`v1.7.8`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/releases/tag/v1.7.8): containerd 1.7.8 [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/compare/v1.7.7...v1.7.8) Welcome to the v1.7.8 release of containerd! The eighth patch release for containerd 1.7 contains various fixes and updates. ##### Notable Updates - **Fix ambiguous TLS fallback** ([#​9299](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9299)) - **Update Go to 1.20.10** ([#​9265](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9265)) - **Add a new image label on converted schema 1 images** ([#​9252](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9252)) - **Fix handling for missing basic auth credentials** ([#​9235](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9235)) - **Fix potential deadlock in create handler for containerd-shim-runc-v2** ([#​9209](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9209)) See the changelog for complete list of changes Please try out the release binaries and report any issues at https://github.com/containerd/containerd/issues. ##### Contributors - Sebastiaan van Stijn - Derek McGowan - Phil Estes - Chen Yiyang - Wei Fu - Akihiro Suda - Maksym Pavlenko - Marat Radchenko - Milas Bowman - Qiutong Song - Samuel Karp ##### Changes
27 commits

- \[release/1.7] Prepare release notes for v1.7.8 ([#​9278](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9278)) - [`48dbdf871`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/48dbdf871b43ca94f243779bd641fcda49c94f66) Prepare release notes for v1.7.8 - \[release/1.7] Fix ambiguous tls fallback ([#​9299](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9299)) - [`68abc543b`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/68abc543b1eb4a8196842de6c83115ba4e5698b0) Check scheme and host of request on push redirect - [`f36948cad`](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/commit/f36948cad712b9f813518ceaa5ac5441b6e10347) vendor: gRPC v1.58.3 - \[release/1.7 backport] vendor: golang.org/x/net v0.17.0 ([#​9276](https://togithub.com/containerd/containerd/pull/9276)) - issue.title: copier: only ever pass Uid,Gid=0,0 to tar.FileInfoHeader()
issue.body:
Let tar.FileInfoHeader() do most of what it needs to do, but only pass it Uid,Gid=0,0 so that it never looks up anything other than that pair. We'll copy those values from the fileinfo.Sys() data ourselves.  _Maybe_ this will speed up the unit tests.  If it does, I'll fill this form out properly.

-->

commits.message:
container.conf: support attributed string slices

All `[]string`s in containers.conf have now been migrated to attributed
string slices which require some adjustments in Buildah and Podman.

[NO NEW TESTS NEEDED]

Signed-off-by: Valentin Rothberg <vrothberg@redhat.com>

Merge pull request #5103 from vrothberg/RUN-1934

container.conf: support attributed string slices

fix(deps): update module github.com/onsi/ginkgo to v2

Signed-off-by: renovate[bot] <29139614+renovate[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

string slices which require some adjustments in Buildah and Podman.

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [google.golang.org/grpc](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go) | indirect | patch | `v1.57.0` -> `v1.57.1` |

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [GHSA-m425-mq94-257g](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/security/advisories/GHSA-m425-mq94-257g)

### Impact
In affected releases of gRPC-Go, it is possible for an attacker to send HTTP/2 requests, cancel them, and send subsequent requests, which is valid by the HTTP/2 protocol, but would cause the gRPC-Go server to launch more concurrent method handlers than the configured maximum stream limit.

### Patches
This vulnerability was addressed by #​6703 and has been included in patch releases: 1.56.3, 1.57.1, 1.58.3.  It is also included in the latest release, 1.59.0.

Along with applying the patch, users should also ensure they are using the `grpc.MaxConcurrentStreams` server option to apply a limit to the server's resources used for any single connection.

### Workarounds
None.

### References

#​6703

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>grpc/grpc-go (google.golang.org/grpc)</summary>

### [`v1.57.1`](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/releases/tag/v1.57.1): Release 1.57.1

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/grpc/grpc-go/compare/v1.57.0...v1.57.1)

### Security

-   server: prohibit more than MaxConcurrentStreams handlers from running at once (CVE-2023-44487)

    In addition to this change, applications should ensure they do not leave running tasks behind related to the RPC before returning from method handlers, or should enforce appropriate limits on any such work.

</details>

---

string slices which require some adjustments in Buildah and Podman.

[NO NEW TESTS NEEDED]
